abstracts.cdata!:
The Industrial Sector Policy Loan, which
            is part of a program of Bank support to the Mexican
            Government's objectives of stabilizing its economy and
            resuming growth, will assist in modernizing the
            country's industrial sector. The loan includes
            deregulation of the industrial sector programs in the
            automotive, petrochemical, pharmaceuticals, and
            microcomputer subsectors, the easing of procedures and
            barriers to entry, increasing of factor mobility, and the
            improvement of the trucking industry. It includes studies to
            identify further policy or legislative changes needed to
            improve the regulatory framework. Deregulation measures
            supported by the loan follow up on other measures already
            undertaken by the authorities. The loan will be disbursed
            against eligible imports.
